intro: Cymopterus acaulis, commonly known as the slender lomatium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the umbelliferous structure. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem and a subject of botanical study.
